CGN3405 - Applied Numerical Methods for.name: CGN3405 - Applied Numerical Methods for Civil Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2313 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better;

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Application-driven numerical solution of common Civil and Environmental Engineering problems using linear algebra, interpolation, differentiation and integration, nonlinear systems, ODEs and IVPs, and linear programming.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: "C" (2.0) or better in a previous CECE design course and department consent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An interdisciplinary capstone design experience requiring problem definition, data collection, analysis of alternatives, economic evaluation of alternatives, and oral and written presentation of final design.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better in EGN 3331C and in CHS 1440 or CHM 2045C or CHM 2041.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The characterization of materials used in civil engineering works to include concrete, bituminous polymers and composite materials.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better in (CGN 3405 or EML 3034C or EEL 4832).

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course is intended to provide a broad multidisciplinary background about the different technologies used in smart sustainable cities with special emphasis to civil engineering.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Civil, Environmental, and Construction Engineering

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAC 2312 and PHY 2049C    both with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Engineering measurement, data analysis, and experimental hardware including electronics, system components, and calibration. Specific applications in civil engineering including surveying, GPS, and GIS
